byline.contributor: Benjamin Kilb contributed reporting from Germany.

abstract: Memo From Germany; Deutsche Post is one of many European postal services that has reinvented itself since 2000 as a multifaceted delivery and information company tailored to the virtual age; it still delivers to every address six days a week, but has jettisoned tens of thousands of buildings and 100,000 positions; United States Postal Service, facing insolvency, has been looking toward Europe for a new operating model.
snippet: Though Deutsche Post still delivers to every address six days a week, it has jettisoned tens of thousands of buildings, 100,000 positions and its focus on paper mail.
lead_paragraph: Though Deutsche Post still delivers to every address six days a week, it has jettisoned tens of thousands of buildings, 100,000 positions and its focus on paper mail.

headline.main: Reinventing Post Offices in a Digital World
headline.print_headline: Reinventing Post Offices In a Digital World
headline.seo: Deutsche Post Reinvents Services in a Digital World
